Submodules

CoREMOF.curate module

Process your CIF to “CoRE MOF” CIF.

class CoREMOF.curate.clean(structure, initial_skin=0.25, output_folder='result_curation', saveto='clean_result.csv')[source]

Bases: object

Removing free solvent and coordinated solvent but keep ions based on a list.

Parameters:

  • structure (str) – path to your CIF.

  • initial_skin (float) – skin distance is added to the sum of vdW radii of two atoms.

  • output_folder (str) – the path to save processed CIF.

  • saveto (bool or str) – the name of csv file with clean result.

Returns:

  • result of curating (name, skin, removed solvent).

  • CIF by curating.

Return type:

CSV or cif

CustomMatrix(neighborlist, atom_count)[source]

convert to matrix.

all_clean(input_file, save_folder, ions_list, skin)[source]

workflow of removing all solvent.

build_ASE_neighborlist(cif, skin)[source]

get list of neighbor.

cluster_to_formula(cluster, cif)[source]

convert to chemical formula.

cmp(x, y)[source]
find_clusters(adjacency_matrix, atom_count)[source]

define cluster by the connected components of a sparse graph.

find_metal_connected_atoms(structure, neighborlist)[source]

get the atom connected with metal atom.

free_clean(input_file, save_folder, ions_list, skin)[source]

workflow of removing free solvent.

mod_adjacency_matrix(adj_matrix, MetalConAtoms, MetalAtoms, atom_count, struct)[source]

modify matrix by breakdown the bond that atom connect with metal atom.

process()[source]

start to run curation.

run_asr(mof, save_folder, initial_skin, metal_list, ions_list)[source]

all solvent function.

run_fsr(mof, save_folder, initial_skin, metal_list, ions_list)[source]

free solvent function.

class CoREMOF.curate.clean_pacman(structure, initial_skin=0.25, output_folder='result_curation', saveto='clean_result.csv')[source]

Bases: object

Removing free solvent and coordinated solvent but keep ions based on PACMAN-charge.

Parameters:

  • structure (str) – path to your CIF.

  • initial_skin (float) – skin distance is added to the sum of vdW radii of two atoms.

  • output_folder (str) – the path to save processed CIF.

  • saveto (bool or str) – the name of csv file with clean result.

Returns:

  • result of curating (name, skin, removed solvent, charge of solvent).

  • CIF by curating.

Return type:

CSV or cif

class CoREMOF.curate.mof_check(structure, output_folder='result_curation')[source]

Bases: object

Not Computation-Ready (NCR) MOFs classification.

Parameters:

  • structure (str) – path to your CIF.

  • output_folder (str) – the path to save checking result.

Returns:

  • result of NCR classification.

Return type:

Dictionary

Chen_Manz(structure)[source]

checking MOF by Chen and Manz method: RSC Adv., 2019,9, 36492-36507. https://doi.org/10.1039/C9RA07327B.

check()[source]

run checking.

mof_checker(structure)[source]

checking MOF by mofchecker 1.0: https://github.com/lamalab-org/mofchecker.

class CoREMOF.curate.preprocess(structure, output_folder='result_curation')[source]

Bases: object

Precheck your CIF.

Parameters:

  • structure (str) – path to your CIF.

  • output_folder (str) – the path to save processed CIF.

Returns:

  • result of pre-check, has metal and carbon, has multi-structures.

  • CIF by spliting, making primitive and making P1.

Return type:

Dictionary & cif

CoREMOF.structure module

Download structures and query information of CoRE MOF Database.

CoREMOF.structure.download_from_CSD(refcode, output_folder='./CoREMOF2024DB')[source]

download structures from CSD, you need to install [CSD python API](https://downloads.ccdc.cam.ac.uk/documentation/API/installation_notes.html) with licence.

Parameters:

  • refcode (str) – CSD refcode.

  • output_folder (str) – path to save structures.

Returns:

downloading CIF.

Return type:

cif

class CoREMOF.structure.download_from_SI(output_folder='./CoREMOF2024DB')[source]

Bases: object

download structures that we got from supporting information.

Parameters:

output_folder (str) – path to save structures.

Returns:

CoRE MOF SI dataset.

Return type:

cif

get_from_SI(zip_path, entry, output_folder)[source]

unzip files from a ZIP.

Parameters:

  • zip_path (str) – path to ZIP.

  • entry (str) – name of structure.

  • output_folder (str) – path to save structures.

Parameters:

zip_path (str) – path to ZIP.

Returns:

name list from a ZIP.

Return type:

List

CoREMOF.structure.get_list_CSD()[source]

get the name list of structures from CSD.

Returns:

  • CR dataset from CSD.

  • NCR dataset from CSD.

  • unmodified dataset from CSD.

Return type:

List

CoREMOF.structure.information(dataset, entry)[source]

get information of CoRE MOF database.

Parameters:

  • dataset (str) – name of subset.

  • entry (str) – name of structure

Returns:

properties, DOI, issues and so on.

Return type:

Dictionary

CoREMOF.structure.make_primitive_p1(filename)[source]

make primitive and make P1.

Parameters:

filename (str) – path to your structure.

Returns:

CIF after making primitive and make P1.

Return type:

cif

CoREMOF.structure.read_aif(GEMC_data)[source]

get adsorption amount of water from GEMC.

Parameters:

GEMC_data (list) – from detail_of_CR.json, for example, information(“CR-ASR”, “2020[Cu][sql]2[ASR]1”)[“GEMC”].

Returns:

  • information,by [“info”] always “(‘_units_loading’, ‘Molecules/Supercell’)”.

  • pressure by [“pressure”].

  • uptake by [“uptake”].

Return type:

Dictionary
